questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the FGCP protocol? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C e D são verdadeiras
C & D Infra6.4 - Page - 312
C & D is correct. No Doubt.
C & D is correct. FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.4 page 312

choices.B: Not used when FortiGate is in Transparent mode
choices.C: Runs only over the heartbeat links
choices.A: Is used to discover FortiGate devices in different HA groups

choices.D: The session is in FIN_WAIT state
choices.C: The session is in FIN_ACK state
choices.A: The session is in ESTABLISHED state
choices.B: The session is in SYN_SENT state

discussion.content: B is correct. FortiGate_Security_6.4 page 182 proto=6tcp/proto_state=02 SYN_SENT

The correct answer: B
In the first line "Session info: proto=6 proto_state=02"
Indicates TCP (proto=6) session in SYN_SENT state (proto=state=2)
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/viewContent.do?externalId=FD30042
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B 100%

Selected Answer: B
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Troubleshooting-Tip-FortiGate-session-table-information/ta-p/196988#:~:text=the%20Reply%20direction-,State,-Value

Selected Answer: B
brld explained it correctly

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. FortiGate_Security_7.0 page 191. 
0=None
1=Established
2=Syn_Sent

Selected Answer: B
It´s B.

Selected Answer: A
So this is A to me. Yes, proto_state=02 =SYN_SENT. However, with SYN_SENT, there's no 3-way handshake yet. In this evidence, we see traffic being sent and received, which doesn't work with SYN_SENT. Additionally, the expire timer is 3600s, which is default for ESTABLISHED. SYN_SENT has a default timer of 120s and it makes to sense to increase this.

Looks like a weirdly cobbled together output, but SYN_SENT zooms in on 1 piece of evidence while ignoring everything that contradicts it.

questions.question_text:
FortiGate is operating in NAT mode and is configured with two virtual LAN (VLAN) subinterfaces added to the same physical interface.
In this scenario, which statement about VLAN IDs is true?

discussion.content: Pretty positive this would be B. You cannot have the same VLAN ID on the same sub interface or there would be conflicts.

Answer A is only correct if we use different hardware interfaces in different VDOMs.

Same VLAN ID, different VDOMs, same hardware interface - not valid.
Same VLAN ID, different VDOMs, different hardware interfaces - valid

Selected Answer: B
For this question the answer is B.

Answer is: A and B
Why A is right, you can see here: https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Note-How-to-use-emac-vlan-to-share-the-same-VLAN/ta-p/192843?externalID=FD43883

Selected Answer: B
think it as sub-interface in router..

Selected Answer: A
I'm totally sure that answer is B, but if we talk about "VDOMS" each VDOM is a different "VFR" that means, you can have in the same physical interface, multiples vlans, with the same VLAN ID, but.. in different VDOM's vlan30 -> vdom root , vlan40 -> vdom user, both interfaces on the same port1 physical interface.

If multi vdoms in multi vlans under 1 interface scheme-> A is also a Correct Answer.

Reference: Page 156, Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 new version!
Answer is B: Fortifgate_Infratructure 6.4 Pg 154

Selected Answer: B
correct

Selected Answer: B
B é verdadeira

Selected Answer: B
Between B and A but i think B.
I think that A is correct logically and B for sure

B - The same VLAN number cannot be configured twice on the same physical interface
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-rules-about-VLAN-configuration-and-VDOM-interface/ta-p/197640

comments.content: Because one physical interface can belong to only one VDOM.

I understand that it is because you can assign interfaces to different vdoms, but not to the subinterfaces, if you have a physical interface assigned to the VDOM Root for example, all the subinterfaces also belong to that vdom

discussion.content: Why not A ?
B without hesitation.
B are correct

B. “Multiple VLANs can coexist in the same physical interface, provide they have
different VLAN ID”
A & B are the correct I guess

choices.D: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they have IP addresses in different subnets.
choices.A: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they belong to different VDOMs.
choices.B: The two VLAN subinterfaces must have different VLAN IDs.
choices.C: The two VLAN subinterfaces can have the same VLAN ID only if they have IP addresses in the same subnet.

questions.question_text: Which statement about the policy ID number of a firewall policy is true?

choices.C: It defines the order in which rules are processed
choices.B: It is required to modify a firewall policy using the CLI
choices.D: It changes when firewall policies are reordered
choices.A: It represents the number of objects used in the firewall policy

discussion.content: B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Fortigate Security 7.0 pg 135

Selected Answer: B
B é a verdadeira

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

comments.content: Strange that you say C is correct while your output points to B

discussion.content:
C is correct --- FortiGate-VM64-KVM # config firewall policy 

FortiGate-VM64-KVM (policy) # edit 
policyid Policy ID (0 - 4294967294).
1 
2 

FortiGate-VM64-KVM (policy) # edit
C. P126. Policy ID is not UUID, UUID is required to modify the policy, Policy ID only for order
C Sec P.126
No doubt, B.
B. FortiGate_Security_6.4_Study_Guide P. 126

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured two-factor authentication to strengthen SSL VPN access.
Which additional best practice can an administrator implement?

choices.D: Configure split tunneling in tunnel mode

discussion.content: C is correct. FortiGate_Security_6.4 page 604 - 605.
C is correct. Security check option

Selected Answer: C
For context, Host Check uses the FortiClient to check that certain conditions on the remote PC are met, such as having AV installed, that there is a specific file located on the PC, that a certain process is running on the PC, or that specific registry entries exist on the PC. Host Check basically ensures that the PC with the VPN Client installed is setup according to your organizations standards.

Selected Answer: C
C é a verdadeira
C is correct
